intro: Breonia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited breonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, inflated, orange-red fruits. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Breonia macrocarpa is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
